result.execSummary:
The defendant Derickus L Jones was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Defendant must pay all outstanding fees and court obligations including costs of supervision during the term of probation.   If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.

No alcohol or controlled substances except by prescription. Random UA's are authorized. Any counseling deemed appropriate by agent. Must obtain and maintain full time verifiable employment. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations while on probation.

timeConds.notes: Must complete drug and alcohol program while in custody. Once complete, the remaining time will be stayed.

Conditions as in Ct 1
Concurrent with: Ct 1

records.addlTxt: Per RASO - mandatory jail time has been served

Defendant Derickus L Jones in court with attorney Nhu Huong Tran.  Defendant Derickus L Jones in custody.  Jennifer C. Tanck-Adams appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Patricia Schaefer.
The State files an amended information. Defense acknowledges receipt and waives formal reading of same; enters NG plea. Upon plea to both counts, the State asks that the Court impose 6 mos RCJ on each count, consec to each other - STAYED, 18 mos probation with conditions to include deft completing drug and alc program in RCJ. Upon completion, the remaining RCJ time to be stayed.
P-G to both
COP filed, rights given
the deft waives right to JT
the State relies on comp for FB - defense stipulates to same
finding of guilt

BTC: guilty as above. 6 mos RCJ on each count, consec to each other - STAYED. 18 mos probation

Conditions:
120 days RCJ. Deft to remain in RCJ until he completes drug/alc program. Once it is complete, the remaining time will be stayed.
costs - 60 days after RCJ time
DNA costs - 60 days after RCJ time
no alc/cs except by Rx-UA's
any counseling deemed approp by agent
 FT emp
Defendant must obey all rules and regulations while on probation

Ms. Tran indicates that there is a drug court offer but drug court is full at this point. Defense indicates that for COP/SEH  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 7, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

records.addlTxt: Pre-trial conference on February 20, 2015 at 08:15 am.
Waiver of Preliminary hearing filed.  Probable cause found;  bound over.

Defendant Derickus L Jones in court with attorney Nhu Huong Tran.  Defendant Derickus L Jones in custody.  Jennifer C. Tanck-Adams appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter Mark Garvin.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 20, 2015 at 08:15 am.
Preliminary hearing on January 21, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report directly to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.   The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  Make all court appearances on time.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

Defendant Derickus L Jones in court with attorney Nhu Huong Tran.  Defendant Derickus L Jones in custody.  Jennifer C. Tanck-Adams appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Pat Phinisee.  Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, bond set.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 21, 2015 at 08:30 am.
